data.text: @enews And there is not supposed to be any “joy” from Hannah’s and Clay’s scenes together. Clay has tried to remove Hannah from his mind all together, not dealing with the emotions and trauma that has followed him from season one. Which I think to many, is very accurate

@enews No testimonies on a show are ever authentic or real or else it wouldn’t be entertainment. And the fact that they use the testimonies as a narration replacement was spot on, considering there are multiple kids with multiple stories

@enews What’s interesting is that 13RW is the only popular show that tackles these types of topics but yet, there are some who seem to be knitpicking at small irrelevant details. the show thrives bc of how captivating and real the subject matter is.

@enews As far as I’m concerned this show starts a conversation that we failed to have when columbine happened, and continue to fail at having with every new shooting and suicide. It’s sad that we talk about it now because a fictional narrative makes us uncomfortable.
@enews I haven't even watched season one of 13 reasons why and I'm way behind well my weekend is a 13 reasons why not to benge 13 reasons why
